file_content.text: Master! You around? I brought somebody to meet you.
An old friend of mine!
Another Jedi master!
A dark lord of the Sith--but don't worry!
They aren't here to sell you anything--you aren't here to sell anything, right?
They're on a genuine vision quest--and I was in it, maybe, so we came right here!
If this "friend" of yours needs a deposit for a Naboo Queen's secret fortune, I swear!
Why in the six gates of Chaos--oh, you're the real thing. I... didn't expect that.
Hah! When is the last time you had company that didn't involve a transaction of some sort?
Well, just make yourselves at home since you're disturbing my meditations. What's this nonsense about a vision quest?
A Voss Mystic started this whole affair. All that really matters is I was looking to meet someone skilled in the Force.
Quest is kind of a leap, but I'm following up on a lead.
Fascinating.
You don't look much like a Jedi. If he's another fraud....
You were a stupid, rude, fathead and you'll mind your tongue in the future.
Uh, master?
You're sorry you brought such an ill-mannered guest, you'll never do it again.
I'm sorry I brought such an ill-mannered guest! I'll never do it again!
Is this what you've been doing instead of that trial I gave you?
Uh, well, when I tried that thing you were showing me the owner thought I was robbing him, so, at that point--to make the best of it--I did.
Guss... did you get my Tarisian ale?
Oh, this isn't even my brand! Go try again.
Hold on, Guss. I want him to explain this training of yours.
What kind of Jedi trial ends in a robbery?
A botched one.
Not your average Jedi, I see.
You won't find many "average Jedi" retiring on Nar Shaddaa.
He was supposed to use a simple mind trick for a discount at the corner store. Harmless enough, I thought.
I'll get it next time--and the Tarisian ale too!
You'll go make my favorite meditation juice while I have a word with our guest.
I'll, er, go make your favorite meditation juice while you have a word with our guest!
What's your interest in my would-be protege?
I need Force-sensitives to help fight the Eternal Empire. Whether that includes Guss, or you, remains to be seen.
There it is.
He seems down and out. I'd like to see him succeed.
Hmph. Nar Shaddaa's only kind stranger.
He's halfway useful to me as he is. You can't just up and take him.
Guss seems more like your errand boy.
He gets out proportionately to what he puts in.
Think you can do better? You're welcome to try.
Let's make a little wager. You perform the minor miracle of teaching Guss the ways of the Force, you can ask me any favor you like.
And if I lose?
Then I get a favor to ask you.
Seems fair. I'm in.
[Refuse Quest] I don't like those terms.
You're on.
I'm not even Force-sensitive.
Oh, well, maybe you should shut your trap then.
[Refuse Quest] Whatever, I've got better things to be doing.
I don't have time for games.
Then you can leave Guss's training to me and be on your way.
Alright, I'll take up your challenge.
Now it's a matter of pride.
Guss! Where's that drink?
Sorry, master! I, err, had to test the recipe, but fifth time's the charm!
Your friend has taken an active interest in your training. Now why don't you both run along and fetch me my Tarisian ale.
Here are a few credits, treat yourself to one of those urchin rolls you like.
Aw, master you shouldn't--this is only half....
I know.
[Refuse Quest] Fine.
For the best then, Guss doesn't need to associate with quitters.
You again? Changed your mind about that wager?
I have.
Guss! How long does it take to chop up a few crates?
I... phew... don't think the training saber actually, um, chops things.
Nevermind that.
[Refuse Quest] I'm just checking in. That's all.
Well, if you continue to insist on dropping in, at least have the decency to bring some wine with you the next time.
Off with you, before I die of thirst.
Languss Tuno, I come to this place daily to pursue inner peace and tranquility, and not through you.
I, ah, got what you wanted, master. Tarisian ale--right brand and everything!
So you have. I suppose I have you to thank for that.
You've lost our little wager.
It would seem so.
It was nothing, really.
Yes, it certainly was.
Well, you certainly weren't getting anywhere with him.
Oh no, I could never match the progress you've made in but a few hours.
Oh--but I believe the condition was teaching Guss to master the Force. I suppose we should test him, just to make sure your lessons took.
Guss, would you kindly trick that Nikto bouncer into giving you a friendly hug?
Uh, well, I--
Yes, master, I would love to!
You must really think I'm stupid.
I'm sorry.
It's him you should apologize to.
I don't know what you mean.
No, maybe you're just stupid.
You don't want the answer to that.
Well, you're a poor cheat, so I wouldn't feel so superior.
What have we learned?
That Nikto have spiky knuckles to go with their spiky faces... and not to lie to you.
Since you're picking things up so quickly this evening, let's try another lesson.
I, er, I didn't get your Tarisian ale....
Come again?
I didn't get your Tarisian ale....
Really? But you had such a fine teacher.
I admit defeat.
Very big of you.
There's no need to be so cruel to him.
Not with you here.
Enjoy your gloating, you shriveled old coot.
Believe me, I will; however, first thing's first.
Had you trained your pupil better I might have had something to work with.
I don't even have a connection to the Force!
What's that? I couldn't hear it over the sound of your losing. The hearing goes first, you know.
I'll get to you in a moment, first things first.
But, master! I did it! I used the Force! It was-- Oh, right! I got the right brand this time. Two for one!
Hmm. Well done.
Figured it out, did you?
He had to follow his own path.
There are many ways to stifle a talent; I've seen more than I ever cared to.
Guss was responsible for his own success, I was just there for support.
Aw, I can't take all the credit.
Of course, I told you I'd teach him how to use the Force.
Well, you're wise if not humble.
I bought you a little present in honor of your becoming my padawan. Three bottles of driftwood-aged Calamari Xinphar, on reserve in the VIP lounge.
Oh, that was... oh. I'm sorry you wasted your savings, master.
You aren't my padawan?
But I didn't--
Really? Aw, master, you shouldn't--sorry I couldn't say that with a straight face. Thank you!
All you need to do is apply what you've learned on that Nikto bouncer barring your entrance.
Now that you're all warmed up, it should be trivial.
Oh sure, now that I've done the hard part, you warm up to him.
He deserves it.
Go on.
So you really do care.
Why you clever old codger.
Birds of a feather.
You think that little speech is going to suddenly fix him?
He never needed fixing.
Idiots like his old master turn gold into dross.
Moderation and thinking for themselves is too difficult, so they embrace rigidity and absolutism instead of trying to find true balance for themselves.
I never got your name, master. I think I'd like it.
Hah, who said I was a master? I was never even knighted. Call me Isaac, if you must.
I couldn't agree more.
Then there's hope yet.
You're no model of moderation.
I've learned my limits, have you?
Some people need those rules. Power is a slippery slope toward becoming a monster.
A little fun never killed anyone.
Moderation is a fool's errand. It's only through passion and desire that fulfillment is achieved.
And yet, you're still a slave to them.
I believe I owe you a favor.
My Alliance desperately needs people adept in the Force to fight Zakuul.
I could use an instructor like you to train more Force users.
You're going to serve me.
I said a favor, not a life-debt.
I'll entertain the idea of cooperating with you from time to time, but I'm staying right here. Guss knows how to contact me.
[Reject Allies] You can keep your favor. I only wanted to wipe that smug look off your face.
You owe me a favor.
It seems I do.
I'm going to regret this, aren't I?
Most assuredly.
I hardly think this was a fair bet.
You never had to take it.
I want you to take Guss. There's only so much he can learn here, or from me. He's got a lot of catching up to do.
Very well.
Of course.
I thought you were taking him as your student?
I won't be far, of course, he is my padawan.
Let the lad enjoy his evening. He's earned it.
Oh, and... be careful out there. Even with all you've seen... you have no idea what you're getting into.
[Reject Allies] Keep him. I'm done with you two.
Oh get on then, it'll be a much better evening once you're gone.
